Community healthcare providers in #VA07 alerted me to the issue, and I started working to rally bipartisan support for protecting #340B. Today, 216 Members of Congress ‚Äì from both parties ‚Äì signed on to my letter demanding that HHS protect the prescription drug discounts.

Big pharmaceutical companies have teamed up with the company Kalderos to try to change the rules of the #340B program ‚Äì without the approval of Congress, or HHS. Their changes would drive up prescription drug prices for the types of healthcare providers I mentioned above. #VA07

The types of providers that depend on #340B discounts include Federally Qualified Health Centers, rural hospitals, Ryan White HIV/AIDS clinics, and safety-net clinics serving low-income Virginians. These places serve some of the most vulnerable people in #VA07.

The #340B program was created by law. In exchange for getting their drugs covered by Medicaid healthcare plans, the program requires drug companies to give discounts to healthcare providers that serve at-risk Americans. #VA07

Today, I demanded that Secretary Azar take immediate action to protect the #340B Drug Pricing Program. Pharmaceutical companies are currently trying to make changes to the program that would spike up drug costs for community clinics and hospitals in #VA07. Thread üëá

The #340B program provides discounts on prescription drugs to clinics & hospitals that serve the most at-risk Americans. Drug companies are now trying to rewrite the rules, and take away these essential discounts.

I'm working to stop them. Details ‚¨áÔ∏è
